dblp.social.hibernate
Class SessionsPool

java.lang.Object
  dblp.social.hibernate.SessionsPool

public class SessionsPool
extends java.lang.Object

This class implements a pool of SodaHibernateSessions. If more than one session is needed it is useful to have a pool containing a fixed number of sessions. This because each session stores all the mapping informations, therefore, in order to avoid memory leaks, it is necessary to control the sessions proliferation.

Author:
Staffiero

Method Detail

initialize

public static void initialize(java.lang.String dbUrl,
                              java.lang.String dbDialect,
                              java.lang.String dbDriverName,
                              java.lang.String dbUser,
                              java.lang.String dbPasswd,
                              int sessionNumber)
                       throws SodaHibernateException
Static method to initialize the sessions pool. Only one session pool is allowed: if this method has already been called a second call will not affect the sessions pool. To create a new pool first you have close the current one with the closePool method.

Parameters:
dbUrl - the database url
dbDialect - the database dialect
dbDriverName - the driver name
dbUser - the database username
dbPasswd - the password for the given username
sessionNumber - the number of SodaHibernateSessions contained in the pool
Throws:
SodaHibernateException

getInstance

public static SessionsPool getInstance()
                                throws PoolException
Static method to get the existing sessions pool.

Returns:
the current session pool.
Throws:
PoolException - if the pool has not been initialized yet.

getSession

public ISodaHibernateSession getSession()
Returns a session contained in the pool. After this call the session is removed from the pool. The class which uses this session has to give it back to the pool when finished.

Returns:
a valid ISodaHibernateSession

sessionBackToPool

public void sessionBackToPool(ISodaHibernateSession session)
Sends back a session to the pool.

Parameters:
session - a SodaHibernateSession previously taken from the pool.

closePool

public void closePool()
               throws SodaHibernateException
Closes each session in the pool and then dereferences each session object. Note that closing a pool does not guarantees the sessions mapping to be removed.

Throws:
SodaHibernateException
